intro: Peucedanum creticum, commonly known as Cretan cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its seeds are small and dry, and it is generally not cultivated for agricultural purposes. Peucedanum creticum is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to arid environments.
